caption.title: Effect of variability in the duration of host outdoor exposure on basic epidemiological indicators.
caption.p: A Estimated mean final epidemic size as a function of k and R index. Vertical dashed line corresponds to the mean value of k obtained by analyzing NHAPS data [ 14] (NHAPS), Miami-Dade County residents data for weekdays (M-D Wd), and Miami-Dade County residents data for weekends (M-D We). Model parameters are assumed at their baseline value as reported in Fig 1B, and N V = 10,000. B As A, but for the outbreak probability. We define “outbreak” an epidemic of at least 100 cases. C As A, but for the peak time. D As A, but for the peak day incidence.
